Jensen Huang, CEO of Nvidia, emphasized the world-class caliber of Chinese AI researchers, highlighting their prominent roles in leading companies like Anthropic, OpenAI, and DeepMind. He praised China’s advancements in AI, citing firms like DeepSeek as notable competitors to U.S. systems, and stressed the importance of global competition in driving innovation. Huang criticized restrictive U.S. export policies on AI chip technology, arguing that such measures hinder American leadership in AI and slow the global adoption of U.S. innovations. 

For professionals and business leaders, Huang’s remarks underline the critical role of collaboration, open markets, and competition in advancing AI technology. His advocacy for U.S. engagement in global markets, including China, suggests opportunities for growth, partnerships, and innovation in the rapidly evolving AI industry.
